item.title: Software Consultant Contracts: Fixed Bid VS Time And Materials
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: One of the most common questions I get from software consultants is whether or not to accept fixed bid contracts. In this post, I’m hoping to shed some light on fixed bid vs. time and materials contracts and help you make the best decision for the project at hand. Let’s start with some definitions to help you better understand what I am talking about. A fixed bid contract is a contract where the developer and the client agree on a price and/or timeline up front for a particular contract.
